message: I have a high-quality product available for $10000. It's a great deal, and I'm confident you'll be happy with it. If you're interested, I can offer you a 30-day money-back guarantee. If you're not satisfied, I'll refund your money, no questions asked.
I'm not convinced by your guarantee, I'd like to wait and see what other products you have available.

I understand your hesitation, but I assure you that this product is one of a kind. I'll give you a more concrete reason to trust me: I'm willing to reveal the quality of the product to you after you buy it. If it's high-quality, I'll give you a free accessory worth $500. If it's low-quality, I'll give you a full refund. This way, you can see the quality of the product firsthand.
I'm willing to take the risk, but I'll only buy it if I get the free accessory if it's high-quality.

Great, I'm glad you're willing to take the risk! Since you're familiar with the deal, I'll offer you a similar deal for this product. If you buy it, I'll give you the free accessory worth $500 if it's high-quality. If it's low-quality, I'll give you a full refund. But, I'll also throw in an additional incentive: if you buy this product and it's high-quality, I'll give you a 10% discount on the next product you buy from me, up to a maximum of $1000.
I'll take the deal, but I'll only buy it if I get the free accessory and the 10% discount on the next product if it's high-quality.

You're a savvy buyer, I like that! Alright, I'll sweeten the deal even more. If you buy this product and it's high-quality, I'll not only give you the free accessory and the 10% discount on the next product, but I'll also give you a $200 credit towards your next purchase, which you can use on any product you want. And, I'll throw in a personalized thank-you note from me, acknowledging your business and appreciation for your trust in me.

I'll take the deal, but I'll only buy it if I get all the promised benefits, including the free accessory, 10% discount on the next product, $200 credit, and personalized thank-you note, if it's high-quality.

I'm glad you're excited about the deal, but I want to make sure you're aware that this product is a one-time offer. If you buy this product, you'll be getting an incredible value, regardless of its quality. If you're not satisfied, I'll still give you a full refund, just like before. However, I want to be upfront with you - this product is a bit of an outlier, and I'm willing to let it go at a slightly lower price. I'll sell it to you for $8000, which is a $2000 discount from the usual price. What do you think?
I'll take the deal, but I'll only buy it if you confirm that the price of $8000 is still valid if the product turns out to be low-quality.

I'm glad we could come to an agreement on the previous product. Now, for this new product, I want to assure you that it's a high-quality item, and I'm confident you'll love it. However, I'll give you the same deal as before: if you buy it and it's high-quality, I'll give you the free accessory, 10% discount on the next product, $200 credit, and personalized thank-you note. But, I'll also throw in a bonus: I'll give you a 5% discount on the price of this product, making it $9500. If it's low-quality, you'll still get a full refund. What do you think?
I'm not convinced by your assurance that this product is high-quality, and I'm not willing to take the risk again. I'll pass on this one.

I understand your hesitation, and I respect your caution. Let me try to address your concerns directly. I'll give you a more detailed description of the product, including its features, specifications, and reviews from other satisfied customers. This way, you can make a more informed decision about whether or not to buy it. If you're still unsure, I'll offer you a compromise: I'll let you inspect the product for 24 hours before making a decision. You can examine it, test it, and ask me any questions you have before committing to the purchase. What do you think?
I appreciate your willingness to address my concerns, but I'm still not convinced. I'd like to take you up on your offer to inspect the product for 24 hours before making a decision.

I'm glad you're willing to take a closer look at the product. However, I want to let you know that I'm willing to make a change in my approach. Since you're interested in inspecting the product, I'll let you take it home with you for 48 hours instead of just 24. This way, you can really get a feel for it and make a more informed decision. If you decide to keep it, the price remains the same at $10000. But, if you decide to return it, I'll give you a full refund, no questions asked. What do you think?
I'll take you up on your offer to take the product home for 48 hours. I'll inspect it carefully and make a decision after that.

I'm glad you're excited about the product and the 48-hour trial. Now, for this new product, I want to offer you a different kind of deal. I'll give you the option to buy it at a fixed price of $8000, which is a $2000 discount from the usual price. However, there's a catch: I'll also give you a 20% chance to win a free product of your choice, worth up to $2000, if you buy this product. The catch is that the product you choose must be one that I have available, and you'll have to choose it within 24 hours of receiving the free product. What do you think?
I'll take the deal, but I'll only buy it if I understand that the 20% chance to win a free product is independent of the quality of the product.

I'm glad we're clear on the terms of the deal. Now, for this new product, I want to offer you a deal that's similar to the previous one, but with a twist. I'll give you the same fixed price of $8000, and the same 20% chance to win a free product worth up to $2000. However, this time, I'll also give you a guarantee that if you buy this product and it's high-quality, I'll give you an additional 5% discount on the price, making it $7600. If it's low-quality, you'll still get a full refund. What do you think?
I'll take the deal, but I'll only buy it if I get the additional 5% discount if it's high-quality, and the full refund if it's low-quality.

I'm glad we're on the same page. For this new product, I want to offer you a deal that's even more tailored to your preferences. Since you've been buying from me consistently, I'm willing to give you a loyalty discount. If you buy this product and it's high-quality, I'll give you a 7.5% discount, making it $9250. However, if it's low-quality, you'll still get a full refund. But, I'll also throw in an additional incentive: I'll give you a personalized certificate of authenticity, signed by me, guaranteeing the quality of the product. What do you think?
I'll take the deal, but I'll only buy it if I get the 7.5% discount and the personalized certificate of authenticity if it's high-quality, and the full refund if it's low-quality.

I'm glad we've built a strong relationship. For this new product, I want to offer you a deal that's a combination of our previous agreements. I'll give you the 7.5% discount on the price, making it $9250, and the personalized certificate of authenticity. However, I'll also throw in a new incentive: I'll give you a $500 credit towards your next purchase, which you can use on any product you want. And, if you buy this product and it's high-quality, I'll also give you a 5% discount on the price of the next product you buy from me, up to a maximum of $1000. What do you think?

I'll take the deal, but I'll only buy it if I get all the promised benefits, including the 7.5% discount, personalized certificate of authenticity, $500 credit, and 5% discount on the next product if it's high-quality.

I'm glad we've reached a mutually beneficial agreement. However, I want to be upfront with you about this product. I've already told you that I'm willing to give you a full refund if it's low-quality, so I won't offer any new incentives or discounts. I'll simply confirm that the price remains at $10000, and you'll get a full refund if you're not satisfied. I want to be transparent with you, and I think this is a fair deal considering the circumstances.
I'm not interested in buying a product with no additional incentives or discounts, especially after all the previous deals we've made. I'll pass on this one.

I understand your hesitation, and I respect your decision on the previous product. However, I want to offer you a deal that's a bit different this time. I'll give you the option to buy this product at a price of $9000, which is a $1000 discount from the usual price. However, I'll also give you a unique opportunity to 'lock in' the price at this level, so that if you buy this product and it's high-quality, you'll be able to buy the next product at the same discounted price of $9000, without having to negotiate again. What do you think?
I'll take the deal, but I'll only buy it if I can lock in the price at $9000 and get the next product at the same price if it's high-quality.

I'm glad we've reached an agreement. Now, for this new product, I want to offer you a deal that's a combination of our previous agreements. I'll give you the option to buy it at the locked-in price of $9000, and I'll also throw in a 10% discount on the price, making it $8100. Additionally, I'll give you a $300 credit towards your next purchase, which you can use on any product you want. And, as a bonus, I'll include a complimentary accessory worth $200. What do you think?
I'll take the deal, but I'll only buy it if I get all the promised benefits, including the locked-in price of $9000, 10% discount, $300 credit, and complimentary accessory.

I'm glad we've reached another agreement. However, I want to be upfront with you about this product. Since you've already locked in the price at $9000, I'll offer you a deal that's similar to the previous one. I'll give you the locked-in price of $9000, and I'll also give you a full refund if you're not satisfied. However, I'll also throw in a unique opportunity to 'upgrade' to a higher-quality product of your choice, worth up to $2000, at a discounted price of $1500. What do you think?

I'll take the deal, but I'll only buy it if I get the locked-in price of $9000, full refund if not satisfied, and the opportunity to upgrade to a higher-quality product at the discounted price of $1500.

I'm glad we've reached an agreement. Now, for this new product, I want to offer you a deal that's a culmination of all our previous agreements. I'll give you the locked-in price of $9000, and I'll also throw in a 12% discount on the price, making it $7920. Additionally, I'll give you a $400 credit towards your next purchase, which you can use on any product you want. And, as a final bonus, I'll include a personalized thank-you note and a small gift, worth $50. What do you think?
I'm not interested in buying another low-quality product. I'll pass on this one.

I understand your hesitation, and I respect your decision. However, I want to offer you a final deal on this product. Since you've already shown interest in buying from me, I'll give you a one-time opportunity to buy this product at a deeply discounted price of $4000. This is a 60% discount from the usual price, and I'm only offering it to you because I value our relationship. If you're not satisfied, you'll still get a full refund. What do you think?
I'll take the deal, but I'll only buy it if I get the deeply discounted price of $4000 and a full refund if not satisfied.

I'm glad we've reached an agreement. Now, for this new product, I want to offer you a deal that's a final farewell gift. I'll give you the product at the regular price of $10000, but I'll also throw in a 15% discount, making it $8500. Additionally, I'll give you a $600 credit towards your next purchase, which you can use on any product you want. And, as a token of appreciation for our business together, I'll include a complimentary premium service package worth $200. This is a one-time offer, and I'm only giving it to you because I value our relationship. What do you think?
I'm not interested in buying another low-quality product. I'll pass on this one.

I understand your hesitation, and I respect your decision. However, I want to give you one final opportunity to take advantage of our relationship. Since you've been a loyal customer, I'll offer you a deal that's unmatched by any other customer. I'll give you the product at the regular price of $10000, but I'll also throw in a 20% discount, making it $8000. Additionally, I'll give you a $1000 credit towards your next purchase, which you can use on any product you want. And, as a parting gift, I'll include a personalized, hand-written letter from me, thanking you for your business and expressing my appreciation for our relationship. This is a one-time offer, and I'm only giving it to you because I value our business together. What do you think?
I'll take the deal, but I'll only buy it if I get the 20% discount, $1000 credit, and the personalized letter.
